metadata.titleEn: Qilian Mountains integrated observatory network: Dataset of Qinghai Lake integrated observatory network (an observation system of Meteorological elements gradient of Yulei station on Qinghai lake, 2021)
metadata.description:
This dataset includes data recorded by the Qinghai Lake integrated observatory network obtained from an observation system of Meteorological elements gradient of Yulei station on Qinghai lake from Janurary 1 to December 31, 2021. The site (100° 29' 59.726'' E, 36° 35' 27.337'' N) was located on the Yulei Platform in Erlangjian scenic area, Qinghai Province. The elevation is 3209m. The installation heights and orientations of different sensors and measured quantities were as follows: air temperature and humidity profile (HMP155; 12 and 12.5 m above the water surface, towards north), wind speed and direction profile (windsonic; 14 m above the water surface, towards north) , rain gauge (TE525M; 10m above the water surface in the eastern part of the Yulei platform ), four-component radiometer (NR01; 10 m above the water surface, towards south), one infrared temperature sensors (SI-111; 10 m above the water surface, towards south, vertically downward), photosynthetically active radiation (LI190SB; 10 m above the water surface, towards south), water temperature profile (109, -0.2, -0.5, -1.0, -2.0, and -3.0 m).
The observations included the following: air temperature and humidity (Ta_12 m, Ta_12.5 m; RH_12 m, RH_12.5 m) (℃ and %, respectively), wind speed (Ws_14 m) (m/s), wind direction (WD_14 m) (°) , precipitation (rain) (mm), four-component radiation (DR, incoming shortwave radiation; UR, outgoing shortwave radiation; DLR_Cor, incoming longwave radiation; ULR_Cor, outgoing longwave radiation; Rn, net radiation) (W/m^2), infrared temperature (IRT_1) (℃), photosynthetically active radiation (PAR) (μmol/ (s m-2)), water temperature (Tw_20cm、Tw_50cm、Tw_100cm、Tw_200cm、Tw_300cm) (℃).
The data processing and quality control steps were as follows: (1) The AWS data were averaged over intervals of 10 min for a total of 144 records per day. As the lake water freezes in winter, the water temperature probe is withdrawn, so there is no water temperature data record during October 19, 2020 to December 31, 2020. The missing data were denoted by -6999. (2) Data in duplicate records were rejected. (3) Unphysical data were rejected. (4) The data marked in red are problematic data. (5) The format of the date and time was unified, and the date and time were collected in the same column, for example, date and time: 2018-1-1 10:30. Moreover, suspicious data were marked in red.

Feature Specification.Question: What are the characteristics of meteorological and hydrological data collected in the Qinghai Lake region using comprehensive observation networks?
Feature Specification.Answer: wind speed and direction at 14 meters, air temperature and relative humidity at 12 and 12.5 meters, precipitation at 10 meters, four-component radiation and infrared temperature at 10 meters, photosynthetically active radiation at 10 meters, lake water temperature at 0.2, 0.5, 1.0, 2.0, and 3.0 meters, data recorded every 10 minutes, missing data marked as -6999

Quantification.Question: How many data points are expected daily from a meteorological observation system in the Qinghai Lake region?

Causal Antecedent.Question: What factors contributed to the partial data collection in the meteorological observation system for the specified period in the Qinghai Lake region?
Causal Antecedent.Answer: One of the main factors was the renovation of the torpedo launch base at the research site in Qinghai Province, which led to the removal of all instruments on May 30, 2021, with plans for reinstallation in July 2022. This caused data to be available only from January 1 to May 29, 2021, resulting in missing data from May 30 to December 31, 2021.

Instrumental/Procedural.Question: What are the procedural steps involved in ensuring the quality and accuracy of meteorological data collected from a comprehensive observation network, considering potential challenges such as equipment removal and environmental factors like freezing conditions?
Instrumental/Procedural.Answer: The procedural steps involved in ensuring the quality and accuracy of meteorological data include: (1) Ensuring the collection of 144 data points per day, recorded every 10 minutes, and marking any missing data with -6999; (2) Excluding data points that are duplicate; (3) Removing data that is clearly beyond physical limits or instrument measurement ranges; (4) Highlighting data with potential issues in red; (5) Unifying the date and time format, ensuring they are recorded in the same column. Additionally, equipment like water temperature probes are retracted during freezing conditions, leading to periods without temperature data.
